ingredients: 1 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese
method: Cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
While the spaghetti is cooking, cook the pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, cheese, and black pepper.
Drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the pancetta. Toss to coat the spaghetti with the pancetta fat.
Remove the skillet from the heat and add the egg mixture, tossing quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Preheat the oven to 500°F.
Roll out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface into a circle.
Spread the tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
Arrange the sliced mozzarella over the sauce.
Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
In a heatproof bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar.
Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water and whisk constantly until the mixture becomes pale and thick.
In a small saucepan, heat the milk until it begins to steam.
Whisk the hot milk into the egg mixture.
Continue to cook the mixture over the simmering water, whisking constantly, until it thickens and coats the back of a spoon.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Season the veal shanks with salt and pepper and dredge in flour.
In a large Dutch oven, melt the butter with the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the veal shanks and brown on both sides, about 8 minutes total.
Transfer the veal to a plate.
Add the onion, carrot, and celery to the pot and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Season the veal shanks with salt and pepper and dredge in flour.
In a large Dutch oven, melt the butter with the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the veal shanks and brown on both sides, about 8 minutes total.
Transfer the veal to a plate.
Add the onion, carrot, and celery to the pot and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
In a saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a simmer.
In a large saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the butter.
Add the white wine and stir until absorbed.
